title: How to Give Your Parade Shoes That Mirror Finish

steps.title: Make sure that your shoes have nothing on them.
steps.content: Make sure that your shoes have nothing on them. If you have polished them before, give them a quick sanding with some fine sandpaper. Make sure they are clean as well. Polishing your shoes is kind of like waxing a car. Just like you wouldn't wax a dirty car, you also wouldn't polish a pair of dirty shoes. Saddle soap works well for cleaning shoes, but you can use baby shampoo and a little bit of water if you're in a pinchâ€”just make sure that the water doesn't soak in.

steps.title: Get some Kiwi Black shoe polish.
steps.content: Get some Kiwi Black shoe polish. Not parade gloss , the paraffin will stop you from getting that mirror finish.

steps.title: Take cotton wool, wet it, rub it on the nose of the shoe, then rub it in some shoe polish and rub that on the nose of the shoe.
steps.content: Take cotton wool, wet it, rub it on the nose of the shoe, then rub it in some shoe polish and rub that on the nose of the shoe. Make sure the layer of polish is rather thin. It is best to work in numerous thin layers to build up a permanent shine. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Get fresh cotton wool, soak it in water, and start to rub it on the nose of the shoe, moving in small circles about 2 centimeter (0.8 in) wide.
steps.content: Get fresh cotton wool, soak it in water, and start to rub it on the nose of the shoe, moving in small circles about 2 centimeter (0.8 in) wide. If they are too big, you will achieve nothing and if they are too small, you will be there forever! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Continue this for as long as it takes, small circles should appear and then they should disappear.
steps.content: Continue this for as long as it takes, small circles should appear and then they should disappear. Once there is no sign of the matt polish, you should get your soft cloth, ideally a microfibre cloth used for cleaning glasses, holding the shoe tight, and buff up the nose really hard and quickly, drying it and giving it that mirror shine. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat it as many times as necessary, as it will take quite a while in the beginning, needing many layers to build up a substantial base of polish.
steps.content: Repeat it as many times as necessary, as it will take quite a while in the beginning, needing many layers to build up a substantial base of polish. Once you have achieved that, it only takes a minute before each and every parade/inspection to retouch it to its full glory. [4] X Research source
